clauses.text: (5) The RMIT Group is committed to:
maintaining a culture that promotes student wellbeing by valuing and supporting an individual’s right to complain
a non-adversarial and conciliatory approach to complaint resolution
responding promptly, equitably and with sensitivity to complaints
ensuring no party to a complaint will be unfairly disadvantaged or face discrimination or reprisal by engaging in good faith with the complaints process
providing transparent processes and accuracy of records
promptly disclosing any actual or potential conflict of interest by all parties in accordance with the Conflict of Interest Policy
reporting allegations of misconduct by staff or students to external authorities such as the police, the Commission for Children and Young People or another government agency where appropriate, and
acting on, learning from and using feedback and complaint data to identify problems, improve services, and address underlying causes and trends to prevent reoccurrence.
considered in accordance with the policy instruments authorised by this policy
assessed and managed in a professional, fair and transparent manner in accordance with the principles of procedural fairness
managed with a focus on resolution, with all parties to a complaint expected to act in good faith and show respect for each other
handled in accordance with the Privacy Policy, privacy laws and other relevant legislation
assessed on their merits, based on evidence relevant to the complaint and any mitigating circumstances.
(7) The RMIT Group is committed to:
the provision of a no-cost complaint resolution process
providing access to independent advice, advocacy and other supports where required and applicable

ensuring the safety and welfare of all parties to a complaint by acting to remove or isolate students or staff from the campus or workspace during an investigation where there are concerns about safety

balancing the right to confidentiality against the principles of procedural fairness by not unnecessarily disclosing the identity of the complainant or witnesses to the respondent where this may constitute a risk to safety.
provides detailed and timely outcomes in writing
acts promptly to implement outcome and review decisions
is accountable internally and externally for its decision making and complaint handling performance
notifies complainants of their right to seek an independent and impartial review of decisions
ensures that reviews are conducted by a case manager who has not had any involvement with the original complaint and investigation
retains records in accordance with the Privacy Policy and Information Governance Policy.
(9) The Academic Registrar is responsible for:
the review and approval of the Student and Student-Related Complaints Procedure and supporting documents
monitoring high risk student and student-related complaints
addressing unreasonable conduct by complainants, witnesses and respondents
authorising notifications to external authorities, including mandatory reporting
reporting of trend and complaint analysis
monitoring compliance with this policy
identifying opportunities for continuous improvement.
(10) The Academic Registrar’s Group Student Complaints are responsible for:
providing processes that enable a consistent, coordinated and supportive approach to student and student-related complaint investigation and resolution
student and student-related complaint case management, notification of outcomes, records and outcome reviews.
(11) Staff are responsible for:
providing ARG Student Complaints case managers with local information in a complete and timely way to support resolution of student and student-related complaints
ensuring continuous improvement is achieved through the immediate implementation of a complaint outcome or review determination, taking action as expressed therein
consideration of, and where appropriate, taking action in respect of any further advice or recommended actions provided by ARG Student Complaints as a result of feedback or a complaint investigation.

(12) All parties to a student or student-related complaint must abide by the expectations under this policy, the Complaints Governance Policy, Student Charter, Statement of Student Responsibilities, and the Code of Conduct.
(13) Breaches of this policy by a staff member will be managed in accordance with the Code of Conduct and Compliance Breach Management Procedure as appropriate.

(14) Breaches of this policy by a student (including any unreasonable conduct) will be managed in accordance with the Student Conduct Policy and the Compliance Breach Management Procedure as appropriate.
(15) This policy will be reviewed at least once every five years in accordance with the Policy Governance Policy.
(16) This policy includes the following schedule:
Schedule 1 – RMIT Complaints Framework
(17) Refer to the following document which is established in accordance with this policy:
Student and Student-Related Complaints Procedure
